tags.name: ActionREST
tags.description: Service for interacting with actions.

tags.name: AdminInvitationREST
tags.description: Endpoints for managing user invitations.  Only master administrators are allowed to perform these operations.

tags.name: AutomaticTaskREST
tags.description:
Service endpoints for managing automatic tasks.  These are "template" tasks that used by rules to instantiate
incident tasks.

tags.name: ConfigurationsREST
tags.description: The endpoints for managing configuration import and export.

tags.name: ConstREST
tags.description:
Endpoint for retrieving various constant information for this server.  This information is
useful in translating names that the user sees to IDs that other REST API endpoints accept.
For example, the incidentDTO has a field called "crimestatus_id".  The valid values are
stored in constDTO.crime_statuses.

tags.name: CurrentUserREST
tags.description:
Endpoints for getting and setting information about the current user.  Note that these methods work only with
the currently authenticated user, even though they accept a user_id path parameter.

tags.name: DataTableDataREST
tags.description:
The endpoint for managing a data table's data for an incident. Tables can be referred to by their internal ID
or their programmatic name. Cell data can be referred to by their internal ID or their column programmatic name.

tags.name: GroupREST
tags.description: Implementation for the /rest/groups REST methods.

tags.name: IncidentArtifactREST
tags.description: Endpoints for managing an incident's artifacts.

tags.name: IncidentAttachmentREST
tags.description: Base class for all REST services that are limited by an org.

tags.name: IncidentMilestoneREST
tags.description: Endpoints for managing an incident's milestones.

tags.name: IncidentNoteREST
tags.description: Base class for all REST services that are limited by an org.

tags.name: IncidentREST
tags.description: Base class for all REST services that are limited by an org.

tags.name: IncidentStatisticsREST
tags.description: Base class for all REST services that are limited by an org.

tags.name: MessageDestinationREST
tags.description: Service for interacting with message destinations.

tags.name: NotificationREST
tags.description:
Implementation for the /rest/notifications REST methods.  These services allow you to determine
which notifications are available for a user, delete them, etc.

tags.name: OrgIncidentArtifactTypeREST
tags.description: Allows orgs to customize settings about their incident artifact types.

tags.name: OrgREST
tags.description: Endpoints for retrieving and setting information about the organization.

tags.name: OrgStatisticsREST
tags.description: Endpoints for retrieving high level statistics.

tags.name: OrgUserREST
tags.description: Endpoints for retrieving information about users in an organization.

tags.name: PhaseREST
tags.description: Endpoints for managing Phases

tags.name: ScriptREST
tags.description: The endpoint for managing the invokable scripts for an Org.

tags.name: SearchExREST
tags.description:
Endpoint for performing full text searches through incidents and incident child objects
(tasks, incident comments, task comments, milestones, artifacts, incident attachments,
task attachments, and data tables).

tags.name: SearchREST
tags.description: Endpoints for searching for tasks and incidents using the search index.

tags.name: SessionREST
tags.description: Authentication REST service implementation.

tags.name: TaskAttachmentREST
tags.description: Endpoints for managing tasks notes.

tags.name: TaskNoteREST
tags.description: Endpoints for managing tasks notes.

tags.name: TaskREST
tags.description: Endpoints for managing tasks.

tags.name: TypeREST
tags.description:
Endpoints for viewing and editing built-in types and fields (incident, task, artifact, milestone, attachment, actioninvocation, and note),
and CRUD operations on custom types and fields (Data Tables)

tags.name: WorkflowREST
tags.description: Endpoints for managing workflows

json_ActionAcknowledgementDTO.title: ActionAcknowledgementDTO

message_type.description: The type of the message.  0 means "info" and 1 means "error".

variables.description: These are variables to be returned to the workflow process

json_ActionAcknowledgementDTO.description: This type is sent from a client that is processing actions to indicate an acknowledgement.

object_type.description: The type of object to which this action applies (e.g. incident, task, etc.). See actionsFrameworkInfoDTO (action_object_types property) for the list of possible values.

conditions.description:
The conditions that trigger this action.  For manual actions, these conditions control when the user will see
the action in the UI.  For automatic actions, these conditions control when the action gets automatically
fired.

message_destinations.description: The list of message destination IDs for this action. See MessageDestinationREST.

workflows.description: The list of workflow IDs for this action.

timeout_seconds.description:
The maximum amount of time in seconds that can elapse before this action
has been considered to be timed out. A value of null indicates that the
action should use the default timeout (currently 1 day).

uuid.description: A unique identifier for this Custom Action.

export_key.description: This value is used for export/import to uniquely represent this field

logic_type.description:
A list of logic types to apply to the conditions. The following are examples:
  • all
  • any
  • advanced

automations.description: The automations run when the conditions for this action are met. They are run in the order of the list.

custom_condition.description:
The custom evaluation string to be used with logic_type = advanced.
Ex: "(1 AND 2) OR 3"
This field must be passed when logic_type advanced is used,
and will be ignored and deleted for both other logic types.

json_ActionDataDTO.title: ActionDataDTO

action_id.description: The ID of the action that triggered. May be null if this was triggered from a workflow.

object_type.description: The type of the object contained in the data.

task.description:
Gets the task data.  Note that this will be null if the action does not apply to tasks.  You can
use the 'incident' property to get information about the task's incident.

artifact.description:
Gets the artifact data.  Note that this will be null if the action does not apply to artifacts.  You can
use the 'incident' property to get information about the artifact's incident.

note.description:
Gets the note data.  This will be null if the action does not apply to notes.  You can use the 'incident' property
to get information about the note's incident.  If the not applies to a task, you can also use the 'task' property
to get information about the note's task.

milestone.description:
Gets the milestone data.  This will be null if the action does not apply to milestones.  You can use the 'incident'
property to get information about the milestone's incident.

attachment.description:
Gets the attachment data.  This will be null if the action does not apply to attachments.  You can use the 'incident' property
to get information about the incident associated with the attachment.  You can use the 'task' property to get information about
the task that the attachment is associated with (if the attachment applied to a task).

row.description:
Gets the row data of a data table.  This will be null if the action does not apply to data table rows.  You can use the 'incident' property
to get information about the incident associated with the data table.

type_info.description:
Gets information about the types.  Note that type_info only includes information relevant to this
action data.  For example, it does NOT include field data values that are not referenced.

properties.description:
Gets the custom properties (fields) associated with this action. This is only applicable for manual actions.
This may be null if it is the result of an automatic action or a manual action without custom properties.

user.description: The user that triggered the action

operation_type.description: Gets the operation that was executed on the object. This way the action processor can determine the current status of the object.

json_ActionDataDTO.description: Holds information sent to a message destination when an action fires.

json_ActionInfoDTO.title: ActionInfoDTO

id.description: The ID of the action.

name.description: The display name of the action.

enabled.description:
True if this action able to be executed in the current context, false
otherwise

json_ActionInfoDTO.description:
Contextual information about an action relative to its owning object.
Returned as part of an object on which an action can be performed e.g. Incident, Task, etc.

json_ActionInvocationDTO.title: ActionInvocationDTO

id.description: The ID of the action invocation

action.description: Basic information about the action invoked.

workflow.description: Basic information about the workflow invoked.

create_date.description: The time and date that this action was invoked.

create_user.description:
The user that invoked this action manually or cause the action to be
invoked automatically.

status.description: The status of this invocation. See actionsFrameworkInfoDTO (action_invocation_statuses property) for the list of possible values.

messages.description: The list of messages returned for this action invocation.

json_ActionInvocationDTO.description: Contains information about an action invocation

json_ActionInvocationMessageDTO.title: ActionInvocationMessageDTO

type.description: The type of this message. See actionsFrameworkInfoDTO (action_invocation_message_types property) for the list of possible values.

text.description: The text of the message received.

create_date.description: The time and date the message was received.

json_ActionInvocationMessageDTO.description: Contains the information about a message received for an action invocation.

json_ActionInvokeDTO.title: ActionInvokeDTO

action_id.description: The ID of the action to invoke

properties.description: The custom properties (fields) to send along with the action data

json_ActionInvokeDTO.description: Contains the data necessary to invoke an action on an object

json_ActionSimpleFieldDefDTO.title: ActionSimpleFieldDefDTO

values.description:
A map of the field values. The key is the "ID" that appears in incident/tasks/etc. The value portion of the map contains the details of the value. This technique allows us to do something like this more easily (Groovy example): 
   println "${actionData.type_info.fields.incident_type_ids.values["${theValue}"].label

id.description: The internal ID of this field. This value is read-only. The server sets this value when the field is initially created.

json_ActionSimpleFieldDefDTO.description: Holds field information for the ActionDataDTO.  Significantly simplified version of FieldDefDTO.

json_ActionSimpleTypeDTO.title: ActionSimpleTypeDTO

fields.description:
A map of the fields.  The key is the name of the field (e.g. "incident_type_ids") and the value is
the SimpleFieldDefDTO (which contains the values that are referenced in the object).

type_id.description: The internal ID of the type. This field is read-only.

json_ActionSimpleTypeDTO.description:
Holds information about a type used in an ActionDataDTO object.  This is a significantly
simplified version of TypeDTO.  It contains only the type information likely to be needed
when processing actions.

A note about implementation...Constructing the fields from the type and filter can be expensive due to database
calls to get field value information.  However most of the time that information is not used.  Therefore
the creation if the field/filter list is deferred until needed (when getFields() is called).  The constructor
just keeps track of the input information and then uses it during the getFields().

json_ActionsFrameworkInfoDTO.title: ActionsFrameworkInfoDTO

enabled.description: Is the actions framework enabled and licensed?

destination_types.description:
A list of possible message destination types. The following are examples:
  • Queue
  • Topic

The key portion of the map is the message destination type id, the value contains the visible name.

action_types.description:
A list of possible action types. The following are examples:
  • Automatic
  • Manual

The key portion of the map is the action type id, the value contains the visible name.

action_object_types.description:
A list of possible action object types. The following are examples:
  • Incident
  • Task
  • Note
  • Milestone
  • Artifact

The key portion of the map is the action object type id, the value contains the visible name.

action_invocation_statuses.description:
A list of possible action invocation statuses. The following are examples:
  • Complete
  • Pending
  • Error
  • Timed Out

The key portion of the map is the action invocation status id, the value contains the visible name.

action_invocation_message_types.description:
A list of possible action invocation message types. The following are examples:
  • Information
  • Error
  • Warning

The key portion of the map is the action invocation message type id, the value contains the visible name.

json_ActionsFrameworkInfoDTO.description: Holds information about the actions framework.

json_AttachmentDTO.title: AttachmentDTO

id.description: The ID of the attachment.

name.description: The name of the attachment.

content_type.description: The content type (MIME type) of the attachment (e.g. "application/pdf").

created.description: The date the attachment was created.

size.description: The size of the attachment (in bytes).

vers.description:
The version of the incident.  This is populated even for task attachments (in that case
it is the version of the task's incident).

actions.description: The list of actions available to the caller for execution.

inc_id.description:
For incident attachments, the incident that this attachment belongs.  For task attachments, the incident
owning the task that this attachment belongs.

inc_name.description:
For incident attachments, the name of the incident that this attachment belongs.  For task attachments, the
name of the incident owning the task that this attachment belongs.

inc_owner.description:
For incident attachments, the owner of the incident that this attachment belongs.  For task attachments, the
owner of the incident owning the task that this attachment belongs.

task_id.description:
For task attachments, the id of the task that this attachment belongs.
Null for incident attachments.

task_name.description:
For task attachments, the name of the task that this attachment belongs.
Null for incident attachments.

type.description: The type of the attachment (incident, task, or artifact).

json_AttachmentDTO.description: Represents an attachment (either a task or incident attachment).

json_AttachmentResultsDTO.title: AttachmentResultsDTO

attachments.description: All attachments which meet the query criteria.

max_results_exceeded.description: Indicates that results have been truncated because the number of matches exceeded the server maximum.

json_AttachmentResultsDTO.description: The results of a query on attachments.

email.description: The email address (user name) to authenticate as.

password.description: The password to use to authenticate.

interactive.description:
true to indicate that the session is an interactive one.  You can only have one interactive session at a time,
so if there is another interactive session it will be invalidated.  The default is false, which means that multiple
simultaneous sessions are allowed.  interactive sessions will not invalidate other non-interactive sessions.  The
default value is false.

json_AutomaticTaskDTO.title: AutomaticTaskDTO

id.description: The ID of the automatic task.

name.description: The display name of the automatic task.

optional.description: Is the automatic task to be an optional task when instantiated?

due_date_units.description: The units for the due date.  Allowed values:  "days", "months", "years".

due_date_offset.description:
The number of units.  If dueDateUnits is "days" then a value of one in this
field means that the task is to be due "1 day" after it was discovered.

instructions.description:
The instructions for the task.  This should generally be HTML, although it
will be cleansed to remove possible cross site scripting issues.

incident_types.description:
The list of incident types for which this automatic task is to be instantiated. The automatic task will be instantiated for incidents who have any of these incident types. See also fullOrgDTO.incident_types (contains a list of all incident type IDs and their corresponding names).
NOTE: This is deprecated as of V28. Starting with V27 incident types are no longer associated with automatic tasks directly. This field was preserved in V28 to provide information about actions that had conditions on incident type. However attempting to create automatic tasks with incident types results in an error. Use the ActionREST endpoint to manage actions and conditions (including incident type conditions).

phase_id.description: The phase this automatic task belongs to

category_id.description: The category this automatic task belongs to.

uuid.description: A unique identifier for the automatic task.

export_key.description: The key which uniquely identifies the object being imported

programmatic_name.description:
The programmatic name of the automatic task.  This is how consumers will identify the automatic task by name
via the API.  If not sent, the programmatic name will be unchanged (in the update case), or will be
automatically generated (in the create case).

associated_actions.description:
List of actions that are associated with this automatic task.  When the automatic task is saved, the task
will be added to all actions that appear in the list. Conversely, the task will be removed from any action
that does not appear in the list. If the value is an empty list, then the task will be removed from all actions.
If the value is null, then the field will be ignored (ie. the task will not be added or removed from any action).

json_AutomaticTaskDTO.description: An automatic task template that gets instantiated when incidents are created or updated.

json_AutomationDefinitionDTO.title: AutomationDefinitionDTO

type.description: The type of the action automation. See AutomationDefinitionType.

type_id.description:
The object handle for the type of the field to modify.  This is only applicable when AutomationDefinitionType is
MODIFY_FIELD.

field.description:
The object handle for the field to modify.  This is only applicable when AutomationDefinitionType is
MODIFY_FIELD.

operation.description: The operation to perform on the field.  This is only applicable when AutomationDefinitionType is MODIFY_FIELD.

tasks_to_create.description:
The tasks to be set.  The tasks are set by the order in the list. This is only valid
when type is AutomationDefinitionType.CREATE_TASK

value.description:
The value used when performing an operation on a field.  This is only applicable when AutomationDefinitionType
is MODIFY_FIELD.

json_AutomationDefinitionDTO.description:
NOTE:  The initial implementation of this was as an abstract class with an AutomationDefinitionSetFieldDTO subclass
like this:

json_BucketBy.title: BucketBy
json_BucketBy.description:
An enumeration of the possible buckets (groupings) for values when performing
pivots.

json_BucketByDTO.title: BucketByDTO

value.description: The value representing the BucketBy.

label.description: The display value for the BucketBy.

bucket_values.description:
The list of possible values the BucketBy will be bucketed into. May be
empty, null, or not present if the values are not constant.

json_BucketByDTO.description: Contains all of the information necessary to understand a BucketBy object.

json_CategorySearchResultDTO.title: CategorySearchResultDTO
json_CategorySearchResultDTO.description: This DTO class is deprecated in v28 and will be removed in v29. GET /rest/search and POST /rest/search are deprecated and being replaced by POST /rest/search_ex which uses a different DTO class to convey the results of the search.

field_name.description: The name of the column field

id.description: The comment's ID.

parent_id.description: The ID of the parent comment (null for top-level comments).

user_id.description: The ID of the user who created the comment. See the fullOrgDTO (users property) for a list of possible user values.

create_date.description: The date the comment was created.

modify_date.description: The date the comment was modified.

children.description: An array of children comment objects (these are "replies" to this comment).

mentioned_users.description:
An array of user IDs who are mentioned in this comment.  You mention a user in a
comment by typing @User.  Note that the client populates this.  That is, the
client will have to populate mentioned_users itself (the server does not currently
parse the comment text to look for mentioned users).

comment_perms.description: An object that describes the current user's permissions on the comment object.

is_deleted.description:
A flag indicating if the comment is deleted.  Generally comment objects are actually
removed from the database when the user deletes them.  However, if the user deletes a
parent comment the parent is just marked as deleted (and it's text is cleared).

actions.description: The list of actions available to the caller for execution.

inc_id.description: The ID of the incident to which this comment belongs.

inc_name.description: The name of the incident to which this comment belongs.

task_id.description:
The ID of the task to which this comment belongs.
Will be null on incident comments.

task_name.description:
The name of the task to which this comment belongs.
Will be null on task comments.

type.description: The type of the comment (incident or task).

inc_owner.description: The owner of the incident to which this comment belongs.

json_CommentResultsDTO.title: CommentResultsDTO

root_comments.description: All root comments which meet the query criteria or have children that do.

incident_comment_match_ids.description: IDs of the incident comments which individually matched the query.

task_comment_match_ids.description: IDs of the task comments which individually matched the query.

max_results_exceeded.description: Indicates that results have been truncated because the number of matches exceeded the server maximum.

json_CommentResultsDTO.description: The results of a query on comments.

method.description: The name of the method (operation) for the condition. You can figure out what "method" values are supported for a field by consulting the fieldDefDTO (operations property).

field_name.description: The field to which this condition applies (if any).

value.description: The value for the condition.

type.description:
The type for the condition. This property is for UI side use only, useful for storing unit of time
in date time filters like (minutes, hours, days)

evaluation_id.description:
The identifier to be used for advanced conditions on actions. If you set logic_type = advanced on the action this condition is part of, you must give each condition a unique evaluation_id from the set (1,2,3,...,n), where n is the number of conditions.
Ex: If you have three conditions, each condition have a unique evaluation_id of 1, 2, or 3.
Any other use of this field will either be ignored or throw an error.

json_ConfigurationExportDTO.title: ConfigurationExportDTO

server_version.description:
The version number from which the import was generated.  If null, then it's a v24.x version that
created it.

export_format_version.description:
The file format version number.  If it's null, it means VERSION_1 because we didn't include it in the
original release.

id.description: The internal ID of the exported configuration.

export_date.description: The date the configuration was exported.

fields.description:
The fields being exported. Will contain any incident-specific fields as well as action-specific fields if
actions were part of the export.

overrides.description: The system task overrides being exported.

actions.description: The actions being exported. Contains both manual and automatic actions.

layouts.description: The layouts being exported. This includes the incident wizard, incident details view, incident close view.

data_types.description: The organization data types being exported.

action_order.description: The order of automatic actions being exported.

types.description: The custom types (currently only data tables) being exported.

incident_artifact_types.description: The incident artifact types being exported.

json_ConfigurationExportDTO.description:
Contains the configuration data from an exported system

Note that v24 exports may contain exposure_vendors, exposure_departments and data_source properties, but those were never actually populated. We also no longer support them in v26+ (instead those values should get included as field values in the incident exposure_vendor_id, exposure_dept_id and data_source_ids fields). We ignore them on import.

json_ConfigurationExportHistoryDTO.title: ConfigurationExportHistoryDTO

options.description: The options selected for the export.

json_ConfigurationExportHistoryDTO.description: Contains all of the information about a previous configuration export.

json_ConfigurationExportsHistoryDTO.title: ConfigurationExportsHistoryDTO

histories.description: The configuration export histories. These are ordered with most recent first.

json_ConfigurationExportsHistoryDTO.description: Contains all of the configuration export histories.

json_ConfigurationHistoryDTO.title: ConfigurationHistoryDTO

id.description: The internal ID of the import/export

date.description: The date that the import/export was created.

user.description: The user that performed the import/export.

json_ConfigurationHistoryDTO.description: Common data between configuration import and export histories.

json_ConfigurationImportHistoryDTO.title: ConfigurationImportHistoryDTO

status.description: The status of the import. Currently the possible values are INVALID, PENDING, ACCEPTED, REJECTED, IMPORT_ERROR.

messages.description:
The informational messages generated when the configuration was initially imported. Contains detailed messages
about the import.

json_ConfigurationImportHistoryDTO.description: Contains all of the information about a previous configuration import.

json_ConfigurationImportMessageDTO.title: ConfigurationImportMessageDTO

type.description: The type of the message. Current valid values are INFO, WARN, ERROR.

json_ConfigurationImportMessageDTO.description: Contains a message relating to a configuration import.

json_ConfigurationImportsHistoryDTO.title: ConfigurationImportsHistoryDTO

histories.description: The configuration import histories. They are ordered with most recent first.

json_ConfigurationImportsHistoryDTO.description: Contains all of the configuration import histories.

json_ConfigurationOptionsDTO.title: ConfigurationOptionsDTO

phases_and_tasks.description: When true it means that phases and tasks are exported.

actions.description: When true it means that actions, message destinations, and custom action views are exported.

layouts.description: When true it means that the customized layouts are exported.

notifications.description: When true it means that the notification definitions are exported.

timeframes.description: When true it means that the timeframes are exported.

breach_data.description: When true it means the breach data are exported.

json_ConfigurationOptionsDTO.description: Contains all of the selected configuration choices for export.

json_ConstDTO.title: ConstDTO

nist_attack_vectors.description:
A map of the possible NIST attack vector values. The key portion of the map contains the IDs and the value portion contains a NISTAttackVectorDTO.

These values come from NIST 800-61 (see http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/nistpubs/800-61rev2/SP800-61rev2.pdf).

See also: incidentDTO (nist_attack_vectors property)

period_types.description: An array of the possible period type values. These values are used when retrieving data from the OrgStatisticsREST resource (see the incidents_by_type_over_time and new_and_open_incidents endpoints).

predefined_items.description: An array of the default wizard items and incident tabs represented by PredefinedViewItemDTO elements.

task_statuses.description:
A map of possible task statuses. The key portion of the map is the task status code. The value portion is a taskStatusDTO.

See also: taskDTO (status property)

states.description:
A map of possible US state values. The key portion of the map is the ID of the state The value portion of the map is a stateDTO.

Note that the ID for a given state is the same as it's geo ID. See the "geos" property.

incident_statuses.description:
A map of possible incident statuses. The key portion of the map contains the status code and the value portion is a incidentStatusDTO.

See also: partialIncidentDTO (plan_status property)

harm_statuses.description:
A map of possible harm status values. The key portion of the map contains the ID of the harm status. The value portion contains a harmStatusDTO

See also: incidentPIIDTO (harmstatus_id property)

crime_statuses.description:
A map of possible crime status values. The key portion of the map contains the ID of the crime status. The value portion contains a crimeStatusDTO.

See also: incidentDTO (crimestatus_id property)

regulators.description:
A map of possible regulator values. The key portion of the map contains the ID of the regulator. The value portion contains a regulatorDTO.

See also: regulatorsDTO.

industries.description: A map of possible industry values. The key portion of the map contains the ID of the industry. The value portion contains an industryDTO.

industry_regulators_map.description:
A map of industries to regulators.  These are regulators that apply for
the specified industry.  The key of this map is the industry ID and the
value is the regulator ID.  See also "regulators" and "industries" properties.

timeframes.description: A map of possible timeframe values. The key portion of the map contains the IDs and the value portion contains a timeframeDTO.

data_types.description:
A map of possible data type values. The key portion of the map contains the data type ID and the value portion contains a dataTypeDTO.

See also: fullIncidentDataDTO (dtm property)

geos.description:
A map of possible "geo" values. A geo is short for geographical region. It can be a region (such as Europe), country (such as United States) or a state/province (such as Massachusetts or Manitoba). The ID portion of the map is the geo ID. The value portion is a geoDTO.

Geo IDs are specified in the incidentCountsDTO to indicate how many records have been lost for a particular state/province.

Geo IDs are also used to specify the state and country properties of the incidentDTO.

data_formats.description:
A map of possible data formats. The following are examples of data formats:

  • Paper
  • Electronic
  • Verbal

The key portion of the map is the data format ID. The value contains a dataFormatTypeDTO.

See also: incidentPIIDTO (data_format property).

artifact_types.description:
A list of possible built-in artifact types. See incidentArtifactTypeDTO.
NOTE: Starting with version 28 this returns only the standard built-in system artifact types. This will be deprecated in version 29.
Using this data structure the incidentArtifactTypeDTO has only the following fields filled in:
id
name
desc
reg_exp
multi_aware
file
Instead of this use ORGRest GET to get the entire list of artifact types from fullOrgDTO.incident_artifact_types to get the full list of artifacts, both system and custom.
For create, update, delete operations on artifact types use OrgIncidentArtifactTypeREST resource.

max_attachment_mb.description: The maximum allowed attachment size (in megabytes).

max_artifacts.description: The maximum number of allowed artifacts to be loaded at same time.

input_types.description:
A mapping of input type name to InputTypeDTO.  This map allows you to get information about input types
in the system (e.g. what "methods" they support for conditions and the valid types to which a type can
be transformed).

action_types.description:
The supported action type IDs and their names.  The key portion of the map is
the ID.  The value portion is the display value.

action_object_types.description:
The supported action object type IDs and their names.  The key portion of the map is
the ID.  The value portion is the display value.

pivot.description:
Get the constant data for pivoting services.

See PivotConstDTO.

time_units.description: A list of the supported time units for automatic tasks and system task overrides.

json_ConstDTO.description:
This type contains constant information for the server. This information is useful in translating names that the user sees to IDs that other REST API endpoints accept. For example, the IncidentDTO has a property called "crimestatus_id". The valid values are stored in ConstDTO's "crime_statuses" property.

This information generally only changes for new releases of Resilient.

json_DataTableCellDataDTO.title: DataTableCellDataDTO

id.description: The internal ID/name of the cell. This can be used to update a single cell value.

row_id.description: The internal ID of the row this cell is contained in

value.description: The value for the cell. The type of the value must match the column allowed value types.

json_DataTableCellDataDTO.description: Contains the data of a specific cell in a data table row

json_DataTableDataDTO.title: DataTableDataDTO

id.description: The internal id/name of the table data. This value is read-only except on create.

inc_id.description: The ID of the incident this table data refers to. This value is read-only.

rows.description: The data rows of the table

json_DataTableDataDTO.description: Contains all of the data related to a user defined table on an incident

json_DataTableRowDataDTO.title: DataTableRowDataDTO

id.description: The internal ID of the row. This can be used to update a single row in a table. This value is read-only.

cells.description: The mapping of column->cell data for the row. The mapping key can be specified using all names or all ids.

actions.description: The list of actions available to the caller for execution.

json_DataTableRowDataDTO.description: Contains all of the data related to a table row on an incident

enabled.description: Flag on whether the item is enabled or not

json_EvaluatableConditionsDTO.title: EvaluatableConditionsDTO

custom_condition.description: The custom evaluation string for the conditions for the advanced logic type

json_EvaluatableConditionsDTO.description: DTO used to deserialize and store all the fields necessary to evaluate a set of conditions

json_FieldDefDTO.title: FieldDefDTO

type_id.description: The internal ID of the type. This field is read-only.

tooltip.description:
The tooltip to display next to the field (i.e. the popup text to display when the user
hovers over the "i" icon).

placeholder.description: The placeholder to display in the edit field (not applicable for all input types).

input_type.description: The input type for this field (e.g. "select", "multiselect", "text", etc.). For a list of valid input types, see constDTO (input_types property).

required.description:
The required status of the field. Valid values:
  • "always" - a value is always required, even when initially creating the object.
  • "close" - a value is required before the object (incident) can be closed. The Co3 UI will prompt the user on close if a value is not available.
  • null - a value is optional

hide_notification.description:
The field should be hidden from the list of fields allowed in notification trigger conditions.  Generally
this should be false for custom fields.

chosen.description:
Is the field a "chosen" field?  This appears in the Co3 UI as "Advanced UI".  It is valid only for select
and multiselect fields.  It's best to enable this option when there will be several values to choose from.
This option allows the user to search the list for a certain value, and is more visually appealing for longer
lists and multiselects."}

blank_option.description:
Should a blank option be selectable in the UI?  Enable this option if you'd like users to have the option of leaving
the field blank.

internal.description: Is this field an internal Co3 field?  This value is read-only.

operations.description:
The set of valid condition operations for this field.  These are the conditions that can
appear in the notification or action triggers section.  This value is read-only.

values.description: The possible values for this field.  This is only applicable for select and multiselect fields.

uuid.description:
The UUID of this field.  This value is read-only.  The server sets this value when the field is
initially created.

perms.description: The permissions the caller has on this field. This value is read-only. This value is set based on the permissions of the caller. See FieldDefPermsDTO.

read_only.description: True if this is a read-only field, false otherwise.

operation_perms.description: The "permissions" for the individual condition methods.

changeable.description:
Can the field values ever change?  For example, the incident create_date field cannot ever change
so changeable will be false for that field.

label_false.description: The label for a boolean false value. Default is "No" and is currently read-only.

label_true.description: The label for a boolean true value. Default is "Yes" and is currently read-only.

label_null.description: The label for a boolean null value. Default is "Unknown" and is currently read-only.

export_key.description: This value is used for export/import to uniquely represent this field

order.description: The order of this column in the table (1 = leftmost)

json_FieldDefDTO.description: Represents a field definition in the system.

json_FieldDefPermsDTO.title: FieldDefPermsDTO

delete.description: True if this field can be deleted, false otherwise

modify_name.description: True if the name of this field can be modified, false otherwise

modify_values.description: True if the values of this field can be modified, false otherwise

modify_blank.description: True if the blank option of this field can be modified, false otherwise

modify_required.description: True if the requiredness of this field can be modified, false otherwise

modify_operations.description: True if the operations of this field can be modified, false otherwise.

modify_chosen.description: True if the chosen attribute of this field can be modified, false otherwise

modify_default.description: True if the default value of this field can be modified, false otherwise

modify_type.description: The other types that this field can be changed to. e.g. select -> multiselect

sort.description: True if this field can be sorted, false otherwise

json_FieldDefPermsDTO.description: Defines the permissions available to the caller on a given field. This object is returned with each field object retrieved by the caller.

json_FieldDefValueDTO.title: FieldDefValueDTO

default.description: Is this value the default?  Only one value in a set of values can be the default for the set.

hidden.description:
Is the value hidden? This is only used for a special case relating to IncidentType
values.  This is a readonly property.

uuid.description: Globally unique identifier for this value. This is a read-only field.

json_FieldDefValueDTO.description: Represents a value in a select or multiselect field.

json_FieldPatchFailureDTO.title: FieldPatchFailureDTO

your_original_value.description:
The value sent by the client (if the client actually sent the value).  Note that the client can omit the
original value, in which case the object version must have been specified and is checked to determine conflicts.
In this case, this property will be null.

actual_current_value.description: The current value of the field.  Someone changed the field to this value and it caused your conflict.

json_FieldPatchFailureDTO.description: Represents a failure to patch a field.

json_FieldRequired.title: FieldRequired
json_FieldRequired.description:
Indicates when (if ever) a field is required.  Use a value of null to indicate that a field
is strictly optional.

json_FieldValModOperation.title: FieldValModOperation
json_FieldValModOperation.description: The operation to perform on a field.

json_FilterContentDTO.title: FilterContentDTO
json_FilterContentDTO.description:
Represents a filter set content, stores filters conditions and columns configuration
Use this DTO to represent content of layouts type LayoutType.INCIDENT_QUERY_FILTER.

json_FullIncidentDataDTO.title: FullIncidentDataDTO

dtm.description: The incidentDataTypesDTO for the incident. This contains information about the types of data that were lost (e.g First Name, Last Name, Credit card number, etc.).

cm.description: The incidentCountsDTO for the incident. This contains information about the counts of records that were lost for the different geographical regions.

regulators.description: The regulatorsDTO for the incident. This contains information about the regulators that are in effect for the incident. Note that the ids property of the regulatorsDTO contains non-state/province regulators. So for example, you'd include the ID of the "GLB Act" regulator here. State regulators will be used if record counts are specified for that state.

hipaa.description: The HIPAARiskDTO for the incident. This contains information required by HIPAA. If HIPAA does not apply to this incident then the hipaa propert can be empty.

tasks.description: Gets the list of tasks for the incident. This data is not accepted on a POST or PUT. It is only used if want_full_data=true is specified when the incident is created. See also taskDTO.

artifacts.description:
Gets the list of artifacts for the incident. This data is accepted on a POST
but not currently on PUT, but it should be in the future.

comments.description:
Set some notes for the incident. This data is accepted on a POST
but not currently on PUT, but it should be in the future.

actions.description: The list of actions available to the caller for execution.

json_FullIncidentDataDTO.description: Class to represent data sent for the creation of events (POST /rest/incidents).

us_enabled.description: Does the license enable US regulators?

canada_enabled.description: Does the license enable Canada regulators?

eu_enabled.description: Does the license enable EU regulators?

actions_framework_enabled.description:
Indicates whether the org has enabled and is allowed to use the
actions framework.

attachments_enabled.description: Can attachments be added to tasks and incidents for this org?

threat_sources.description:
A map of threat sources for this organization. All threat sources that Co3 supports are included in this list. The "enabled" property will be set to false if it is not enabled for this organization. See threatSourceDTO.

The key portion of the map contains the ID of the threat source. The value portion of the map contains the threatSourceDTO

phases.description: A map of all the possible incident phases. The ID portion of the map contains the ID of the phase. The value portion contains the phaseDTO.

attachments_used_bytes.description: The number of bytes the organization is currently using for attachment storage. If this value is not requested, it will be returned as -1. To retrieve this value, see GET /orgs/{orgId}/settings

users.description: Gets a user ID to userDTO map. This allows the caller to map the ID values returned by other APIs to user names.

geos.description: A map of geo ID to orgGeoDTO. This identifies jurisdictions (geos) the company conducts business and/or has customer data.

groups.description: A map of group ID to groupDTO. This map contains all of the groups defined in the organization.

regs.description:
A map of regulator ID to boolean values that indicates which regulators are enabled by default
for the organization.

properties.description: An array of organization properties.  These are general purpose properties associated with the organization.

incident_types.description:
A map of incident type ID incidentTypeDTO. This is the list of incident types defined for the organization.

See also incidentDTO (incident_type_ids property).

artifact_types.description:
Relatability settings for incident artifact types.
The ID portion of the map contains the ID of the artifact type. The value portion contains the orgIncidentArtifactTypeDTO.
NOTE: This is deprecated in version 28. Please use incident_artifact_types instead.

incident_artifact_types.description: Incident artifact types for this organization. The ID portion of the map contains the ID of the artifact type. The value portion contains the incidentArtifactTypeDTO.

id.description: The organization ID.

task_categories.description: A map of all the possible task categories. The ID portion of the map contains the ID of the category. The value portion contains the taskCategoryDTO.

json_FullUserDTO.title: FullUserDTO

incs_assigned.description: The number of incidents to which the user is assigned.

tasks_assigned.description: The number of tasks to which the user is assigned.

json_FullUserDTO.description: Contains additional information about a user (beyond what's available in UserDTO).

json_FunctionType.title: FunctionType
json_FunctionType.description: An enumeration representing the possible functions which may be applied to pivot cell contents to determine the cell value.

json_FunctionTypeDTO.title: FunctionTypeDTO

value.description: The value representing the FunctionType.

label.description: The display value for the FunctionType.

field_types.description: The list of PivotFieldTypes to which this function applies.

json_FunctionTypeDTO.description: Contains all of the information necessary to understand a FunctionType object.

json_GeoType.title: GeoType
json_GeoType.description: The type of a geographic region.

json_GeoUnassignedDTO.title: GeoUnassignedDTO
json_GeoUnassignedDTO.description: Indicates an "unassigned" count for a particular geo. These unassigned counts would generally be for "country". For example, if you know that you lost 500 records for the United States but you didn't know what specific state the records were for, you'd put them in as unassigned for the United States geo (ID #1000): { "geo": 1000, "count": 500 }

id.description: The ID of the group

name.description: The name of the group.

members.description: Array of the IDs of the members of the group.

is_assignable.description: Flag to indicate if the group can be assigned to incidents.

ldap_dn.description: The distinguished name of the LDAP group that this group should include users from.

ldap_members.description: The LDAP users who are implicitly members of this group do to the LDAP link association.

json_HIPAARiskDTO.title: HIPAARiskDTO

hipaa_adverse.description:
Given the nature and extent of the PHI involved, is it likely that the information could be used by an unauthorized recipient in a manner adverse to the individual or otherwise used to further the unauthorized recipient's own interests?

Specify null to indicate that you do not know.

hipaa_misused.description:
Is it likely that the unauthorized recipient has misused or will misuse the information?

Specify null to indicate that you do not know.

hipaa_acquired.description:
Was the information actually acquired or viewed?

Specify null to indicate that you do not know.

hipaa_additional_misuse.description:
Is it likely that additional or further misuse of the data will occur?

Specify null to indicate that you do not know.

hipaa_breach.description:
Based on your overall assessment of the incident, is it likely that a breach has occurred? Note: A true value will result in notification tasks being generated. You may also provide true if your organization chooses to forego the assessment and notify regarding all incidents.

Specify null to indicate that you do not know.

hipaa_adverse_comment.description: Any additional notes relating to the hipaa_adverse property.

hipaa_misused_comment.description: Any additional notes relating to the hipaa_misused property.

hipaa_acquired_comment.description: Any additional notes relating to the hipaa_acquired property.

hipaa_additional_misuse_comment.description: Any additional notes relating to the hipaa_additional_misuse property.

hipaa_breach_comment.description: Any additional notes relating to the hipaa_breach property.

json_HIPAARiskDTO.description: Information that is required for incidents related to HIPAA.

json_IdentifierDTO.title: IdentifierDTO
json_IdentifierDTO.description:
Some REST methods return just an ID value. They use this class for their
return.

json_IncidentArtifactDTO.title: IncidentArtifactDTO

id.description: The artifact ID.

type.description: The type of the artifact.  See constDTO.artifact_types for a list of all possible values.

value.description:
The value of the artifact.  This would be, for example, the IP address for an IP address artifact.  When
adding artifacts, the value can include multiple whitespace-separated values in this text field if the
artifact type's is_multi_aware flag is true (see constDTO.artifact_types)

creator.description: Gets the creator of this artifact

hits.description: Read-only field containing a list of all of the threat source hits for this artifact.

attachment.description: The artifact attachment (null indicates that the artifact has no attachment).

created.description: The date/time the artifact was created.

pending_sources.description: The IDs of any threat sources that are still in the process of being checked for this artifact.

perms.description: The current user's read/write/delete permissions are.

location.description: The location of the incident artifact

actions.description: The list of actions available to the caller for execution.

relating.description:
Whether or not this artifact should be used for relating to other incidents. Null means use the default specified
by the type, true to always relate, false to never relate.

json_IncidentArtifactDTO.description: Contains information about an incident artifact.

json_IncidentArtifactPermsDTO.title: IncidentArtifactPermsDTO

read.description: Can the current user read/see the artifact?

write.description: Can the current user write to the artifact?

delete.description: Can the current user delete the artifact?

json_IncidentArtifactPermsDTO.description: Stores the current user's permissions on an artifact.

json_IncidentArtifactResultDTO.title: IncidentArtifactResultDTO
json_IncidentArtifactResultDTO.description: This DTO class is deprecated in v28 and will be removed in v29. GET /rest/search and POST /rest/search are deprecated and being replaced by POST /rest/search_ex which uses a different DTO class to convey the results of the search.

id.description: ID of the artifact type. This is a read-only field.

name.description: Display name of the artifact type.

file.description: The value of an artifact of this type is a file. The artifact is created using IncidentArtifactREST resource.

reg_exp.description: This is used to validate the value of artifacts of this type.

multi_aware.description:
When true, the value of an artifact of this is type is scanned, and if multiple artifact values are detected
multiple artifacts are created from the single artifact.

programmatic_name.description: This is the name used by scripting when referencing this artifact type. This is also can be used when referencing artifact types by ObjectHandle.

uuid.description: The system UUID of the object used as a backup to detect renames

parse_as_csv.description: If true and the artifact type is mutli aware then the value is parsed using comma separated value format.

use_for_relationships.description:
If true this artifacts of this type are used for determining relationships to other incidents. Otherwise the
artifact is not used for determining relationships.

system.description: Is this artifact type pre-defined by the system.  This is a read-only attribute.

split_on.description: Splitter on pattern used with multiple values.  This is a readonly property.

version.description: Version of the artifact type.  This is a read-only field.

export_key.description: The key which uniquely identifies the object being imported

json_IncidentCommentDTO.title: IncidentCommentDTO
json_IncidentCommentDTO.description: This object represents an incident comment. This class is being deprecated in v27.2 and will be removed in v29. Applications using this class should switch to using the CommentDTO class instead.

json_IncidentCountsDTO.title: IncidentCountsDTO

unassigneds.description: An list of objects that describes the "unassigned" records for the incident.

total.description:
The total number of records that were lost.  This is calculated by the server and
is a read only property.

geo_counts.description: A map of the record counts for the different geographic regions involved with the incident. For example, the following indicates that 100 records were lost in California (ID #6) and 200 records were lost in Delaware (ID #9): { "6": 100, "9": 200 } The list of possible geos (with their IDs) is available in the constDTO (geos property).

json_IncidentCountsDTO.description:
This type represents the counts of records that were lost as part of an
incident.

json_IncidentDTO.title: IncidentDTO

vers.description:
The version of the incident.  Note that if you attempt to save an incident and the vers
field doesn't match the current version, you will get a 409 "conflict" HTTP error code.
This is done so you don't overwrite another user's changes.

addr.description: The address where the incident occurred (e.g. 125 Main Street).

city.description: The city where the incident occurred.

creator_id.description: The ID of the user that created the incident.  This is a read-only property.

creator.description:
A justUserDTO object that represents the creator.  This object
will include the creator's email address, first name, last name, etc.

crimestatus_id.description: The ID of the crime status. See also constDTO (crime_statuses property).

employee_involved.description:
Was an employee involved? true means that an employee was known to be involved. false means that an employee was definitely not involved. A null value means that it is unknown whether an employee was involved.

This value generally only applies if the "exposure type" is "individual". That is, if the incident was caused by an individual person.

end_date.description: The date the incident was closed.  This is a read-only property.

exposure_dept_id.description:
The department within the company that the incident was related to.

This value generally only applies if the "exposure type" is "individual". That is, if the incident was caused by an individual person.

exposure_individual_name.description:
The free-form text name of the individual who caused the incident. For example, if Mary Jones lost her laptop then you would set the exposure_individual_name to "Mary Jones".

This value generally only applies if the "exposure type" is "individual". That is, if the incident was caused by an individual person.

exposure_vendor_id.description:
The vendor who caused the incident.

This value generally only applies if the "exposure type" is "external party". That is, if the incident was caused by an external party.

incident_type_ids.description:
The IDs of the incident types. An incident type is something like Malware, Phishing, etc.

The list of possible incident types and their ID values can be retrieved using the OrgREST resource (perform a GET on the /rest/orgs/{orgId} endpoint), which will return a fullOrgDTO object. This object has an "incident_types" property that will contain the valid values.

jurisdiction_name.description: If this incident was a crime then this property indicates where it was a crime.

reporter.description: Free form text field indicating who reported the incident.

state.description: The state where the incident occurred. This is a geo ID. See constDTO (states property) for the possible values.

country.description: The country where the incident occurred. This is a geo ID. See constDTO (geos property) for the possible values.

zip.description: The ZIP/postal code where the incident occurred.

exposure.description:
The total amount of money (in US dollars) that you could be fined if you ignore this incident. This is calculated by the Co3 rules engine based on the information that you provided.

This is a readonly property.

org_id.description:
The ID of the organization where the incident resides.

This is a readonly property.

is_scenario.description:
true if the incident is to be run as a what-if scenario. In this case the incident is not saved to the database, but it's assessment property is set and (if want_full_data was requested) the fullIncidentDataDTO (tasks property) is set.

Setting this value to false will cause an incident to be created.

members.description:
The list of member user IDs.

The list of users is available in the fullOrgDTO (users property).

negative_pr_likely.description:
Is a negative "public relations" (PR) response likely because of this incident?  true indicates
that a negative PR response is likely.  false indicates that a negative PR response is unlikely.
A null value means that you do not know if a negative PR value is likely or unlikely.

perms.description:
Indicates that the current user's permissions are to various elements of the
incident.  For example, is the current user allowed to change the membership
of the incident (stored in the change_members property of the returned object).

confirmed.description:
Is the incident confirmed?  Specify true if you're sure this is an incident.  Specify
false if you're not yet sure.  As an example, consider the case where a SIEM system
reports suspicious activity that you want to investigate.  The automatic entry of the
incident would set confirmed = false.  Once a human investigates and determines that
an incident actually occurred, the user would set this field to true through the Co3 UI.

task_changes.description:
Gets information about what tasks were added or removed by the previous PUT operation. This only applies for PUT operations where the incident has changed causing an automatic change to one or more tasks.

This is a readonly property.

exposure_type_id.description:
The exposure type for the incident.  This is used to track the origin of the exposure.
For example, was the origin of the incident an "individual" or "external party".

assessment.description:
An XML text string describing the high-level assessment of the incident.

This is a readonly property.

data_compromised.description:
Has data been compromised because of the incident?  Specify true to indicate
that data was definitely compromised.  Specify false to indicate that
data was definitely not compromised.  Specify a null value to indicate that
you do not yet know if data was compromised (a task will be created to
get you to investigate.)

nist_attack_vectors.description:
A list of IDs of all of the NIST attack vectors that apply.

These values come from NIST 800-61 (see http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/nistpubs/800-61rev2/SP800-61rev2.pdf).

Note that the IDs specified here are internal Co3 IDs. The list of IDs is available in the constDTO (nist_attack_vectors property).

properties.description:
The custom properties (fields) for this incident.  Use this to set/get custom properties
for the incident.  For example, if you have a custom field called moon_phase then you would
set/get it's value using incident.properties.moon_phase.

pii.description: The incidentPIIDTO for the incident. This contains information about privacy breaches.

json_IncidentDTO.description: This object contains a minimal subset of the incident data.  It is useful for displaying in a list.

json_IncidentDataTypesDTO.title: IncidentDataTypesDTO
json_IncidentDataTypesDTO.description: This is a dynamic map that indicates which data types (e.g. Credit card number, SSN or SIN, etc.) that were lost as part of the incident. The key portion of the map is the data type ID and the value portion is a true/false boolean indicating whether the data type was lost. For example, the following JSON object indicates that the first name (id #19) and last name (id #20) were lost: { "19": true, "20": true } The list of possible data types (with their ID values) is available in the constDTO (data_types property).

data_compromised.description:
Whether sensitive or personal data was foreseeably exposed and/or compromised. A value of true or null ("Unknown") indicate that a breach response may be required.
true means that data was compromised. false means that data definitely was not compromised. null means that you don't know.

harmstatus_id.description: The harm status of the incident. The possible values are specified in the constDTO (harm_statuses property).

data_contained.description:
Was the data contained and the exposure resolved?  true means that the
exposure has been resolved; false means that it has not been resolved; null
means that you do not know if it has been resolved.

data_source_ids.description:
An array of data source IDs for the incident.  These values are
configured specifically for your organization.

data_format.description: The format the data was in (e.g. Paper, Electronic or Verbal). The possible values are available in the constDTO (data_formats property).

assessment.description:
An XML text string describing the high-level assessment of the incident.
This is a readonly property.

exposure.description:
The total amount of money (in US dollars) that you could be fined if you ignore this incident. This is calculated by the Co3 rules engine based on the information that you provided.

This is a readonly property.

gdpr_harm_risk.description:
Likelihood and severity of the risk to the rights and freedoms of the data subject, as defined by the GDPR.

This field is only interpreted if the GDPR regulator is chosen for the incident. The regulator is specified using the incident's regulators.ids property. The list of valid regulators is available in the ConstDTO regulators property.

gdpr_lawful_data_processing_categories.description:
Under the GDPR, processing of personal or sensitive data is only lawful if one or more of these categories applies.

This field is only interpreted if the GDPR regulator is chosen for the incident. The regulator is specified using the incident's regulators.ids property. The list of valid regulators is available in the ConstDTO regulators property.

json_IncidentResultDTO.title: IncidentResultDTO
json_IncidentResultDTO.description: This DTO class is deprecated in v28 and will be removed in v29. GET /rest/search and POST /rest/search are deprecated and being replaced by POST /rest/search_ex which uses a different DTO class to convey the results of the search.

id.description: The ID of the incident status.

isclosed.description: Does the status represent a "closed" status?

name.description: The name of the status.

json_IncidentSummaryDTO.title: IncidentSummaryDTO

offset.description: Your timezone offset in minutes from the UTC. e.g. +240 for GMT-4 and -240 for GMT+4. See also JavaScript getTimezoneOffset() Method

fieldsToInclude.description: List of object handles for incident fields. See fieldDefDTO.

json_IncidentSummaryDTO.description: Configuration options for exported incident data.

json_IncidentTypeDTO.title: IncidentTypeDTO

id.description: The ID of the incident type.

name.description: The name of the incident type (e.g. "Malware").

description.description: A description of the incident type.

create_date.description: The date the incident type was created.

update_date.description: The date the incident type was last updated.

parent_id.description:
The ID of the parent incident type.  Incident types can "inherit" from other incident types.  For example,
you might have an incident type called "Lost Laptop" that will have various automatic tasks associated
with it (like "Buy a new laptop for the employee").  You might have another incident type that inherits
from this called "Lost Executive Laptop" that would have additional tasks associated with it.

hidden.description: Is the incident type to be hidden from view when creating incidents?

system.description: Is this a system-defined incident type?

uuid.description: The UUID for this incident type

export_key.description: This value is used for export/import to uniquely represent this incident type

json_IncidentTypeDTO.description: Represents an incident type in the system (e.g. Malware, Phishing, etc.).

json_InputType.title: InputType
json_InputType.description: A type of input field in the system.

json_InputTypeDTO.title: InputTypeDTO

name.description: The name of the type (e.g. "select", "multiselect", "text", etc.).

supported_methods.description: The operations that this type supports. See conditionDTO's (method property).

valid_transformations.description: These are the list of other input types that this type could be changed to.

The status of the user. The following values are possible:
  • 'A' - the user is active.
  • 'D' - the user is deactivated.
  • 'I' - the user is inactive.
  • 'P' - the user is pending activation (i.e. an invitation was created but not accepted by the user).
  • 'R' - the user is being reset.
  • 'U' - the user is unknown (used for external users).

Gets the element. This can be one of:
  • field - the item is a field reference. The field name is stored in the content property.
  • html - the item is an HTML block. The HTML content is stored in the content property.
  • header - the item is a header. The header text is stored in the content property.
  • section - the item is a section. The content property is ignored. The list of sub-items is stored in the "fields" property.
  • tab - the item is a tab. The content property is ignored. The list of sub-items (sections, fields, etc.) is stored in the "fields" property.

The type of object to which this view item applies. Currently, the following values are supported:

json_NotificationDTO.description:
Represents a notification in the system.

Prior to version 28 the template definition and substitution values are provided so the API client can perform substitution. Starting with version 28 the template functionality has been been expanded and substitution is performed on the server and provided back as part of this object in notification_text.

Starting with version 29 the following fields will be removed:

inc_id

inc_training

task_name

task_id

comment_text

comment_id

json_ObjectHandle.title: ObjectHandle

id.description:
Gets the ID referred to by this object (generally an integer value).  This can be null in cases
where you know the name, but not the ID.

name.description:
Gets the name referred to by this object.  This can be null in cases where you know
the ID but not the name.

json_ObjectHandle.description:
A handle to an object in the REST API. The handle can be an object ID (integer) or an object name (string). The server will recognize the type and lookup the object.

For example, the incidentDTO's resolution_id field can be specified as the name of the resolution selection (e.g. "Duplicate") or with it's ID value (which you have to lookup separately).

Note that data is returned from the server with the ID values by default. If you wish to receive name values back for objectHandle fields from the server instead, you can set handle_format=names either in a query string (e.g. https://resilient.mycompany.com/rest/orgs/:orgId/incidents?handle_format=names) or in an HTTP header. For a description of the possible values of the handle_format query string parameter/HTTP header, see objectHandleFormat.

When setting ObjectHandle values the server will work with either format. You only need to indicate what type of output you want. Versions of the Resilient Systems server prior to v23 only accepted ID values and would convert string values ("55") to integers where possible. As of v23, the server will not automatically convert strings to their number equivalent. So if your API program used to send "55" assuming that the server would convert it to 55, you will either have to change your program to send the integer or you can work around the problem by setting handle_format=ids, which will again allow the conversion to happen.

json_ObjectHandleFormat.title: ObjectHandleFormat
json_ObjectHandleFormat.description:
Represents the type of output you want for objectHandle objects. You can specify which behavior you want by setting the handle_format HTTP header or query string parameter. For example, if retrieving an incident and you want to get back "names", you could use this URL: 
https://server/rest/orgs/201/incidents/54321?handle_format=names

If both the HTTP header and query string are specified, the query string takes precedence. This allows you to specify a default in the HTTP header, but override it on a per-request basis.

json_ObjectHandleList.title: ObjectHandleList
json_ObjectHandleList.description:
Represents a list of ObjectHandle objects.  Each item in the list can be either
a name (string) or ID (integer).

The prefix to use when setting the field value in a DTO. For example, the prefix for the "data_source_ids" field is "pii". When setting the value in an incident, you must include "data_source_ids" in a sub-JSON object named "pii". For example: 
   {
     "id": 555,
     "name": "Test incident",
     ...
     "pii": {
       "data_source_ids": [1234, 1235],
       ...
     }
   }

The list of all available users is in the fullOrgDTO (users property).

The possible values are available in the fullOrgDTO (phases property).

The incident status.

The possible values with their names are available in constDTO (incident_statuses property).

inc_training.description:
true if this is a training incident (aka simulation).  false indicates that it is
a normal incident.

json_PartialIncidentDTO.description: This object contains a minimal subset of the incident data.  It is useful for displaying in a list.

org_id.description: The org to restrict search to (or null for all orgs which the user is a member of)

types.description:
The types of object to restrict the search to. Can be null to request all types Types are the string form of the internal type id of the Resilient type. Composed of the following: 
 incident
 task
 note
 milestone
 artifact
 attachment
 datatable
For more information about type ids, refer to this

filters.description: Filters for the query. The key is the TypeId ("incident", "task", ...), and, due to legacy reasons, the value is an array consisting of 1 QueryFilterDTO to store all the conditions on that TypeId

min_required_results.description:
The minimum number of results to retrieve for a given search.  If not specified, a server-specified limit
will be imposed

json_SearchExResultDTO.title: SearchExResultDTO

type_id.description:
The type id of the result . Must be one of the following: 
 incident
 task
 note
 milestone
 artifact
 attachment
 datatable
For more information about type ids, refer to this

org_id.description: The unique identifier of the Organization that this search result belongs to.

obj_id.description: The unique identifier of the search result

obj_name.description:
The name of the search result object.  In the case of a data table row, this name represents the
programmatic name of the data table.

Can be null for objects with no names (e.g. notes)

obj_owner_id.description:
The name of the owner of the search result.  Search results of types milestone, artifact,
attachment and datatable do not support the notion of 'owner' so the value would be null.

In the case of a comment (type = note), obj_owner_id would represent a user who has subsequently
modified the comment.  If it hasn't been modified, this value would be null.

obj_creator_id.description:
The name of the creator of the search result.  Datatables do not support a creator, so search results
of that type would be null.

obj_state.description: The state of the search result.  This is only applicable for incidents and tasks.

obj_create_date.description: The creation date of the search result.  This can be null for results which do not have a creation date stored.

inc_id.description:
The id of the incident to which the search result belongs.  If the search result is an incident, then inc_id
is identical to obj_id.

inc_name.description:
The name of the incident to which the search result belongs.  If the search result is an incident, then inc_name
is identical to obj_name.

inc_owner_id.description:
The name of the owner of the incident to which the search result belongs.  If the search result is an incident,
then inc_owner is identical to obj_owner.

task_id.description:
The id of the task to which the search result belongs.  This is only populated for task, task attachment,
and task notes.  In the case of task, task_id is identical to obj_id.
If the search result belongs to an incident only (i.e. incident, incident note, incident attachment, artifact
or datatable) then this result is null.

task_name.description:
The name of the task to which the search result belongs.  This is only populated for task, task attachment,
and task notes.  In the case of task, task_name is identical to obj_name.
If the search result belongs to an incident only (i.e. incident, incident note, incident attachment, artifact
or datatable) then this result is null.

match_field_name.description: The name of the search field where a match was found.

match_field_value.description:
The value of the search field where a match was found, including an indication of what term(s) matched the
full text search.

score.description: A score value for the search hit

result.description: The actual object returned by the search
