xml_ns0_configurationImportHistoryDTO.description: Contains all of the information about a previous configuration import.

xml_ns0_configurationImportMessageDTO.title: configurationImportMessageDTO

type.description: The type of the message. Current valid values are INFO, WARN, ERROR.

xml_ns0_configurationImportMessageDTO.description: Contains a message relating to a configuration import.

xml_ns0_configurationImportsHistoryDTO.title: configurationImportsHistoryDTO

histories.description: The configuration import histories. They are ordered with most recent first.

xml_ns0_configurationImportsHistoryDTO.description: Contains all of the configuration import histories.

xml_ns0_configurationOptionsDTO.title: configurationOptionsDTO

actions.description: When true it means that actions, message destinations, and custom action views are exported.

breach_data.description: When true it means the breach data are exported.

layouts.description: When true it means that the customized layouts are exported.

notifications.description: When true it means that the notification definitions are exported.

phases_and_tasks.description: When true it means that phases and tasks are exported.

timeframes.description: When true it means that the timeframes are exported.

xml_ns0_configurationOptionsDTO.description: Contains all of the selected configuration choices for export.

field_name.description: The name of the column field

xml_ns0_filterContentDTO.title: filterContentDTO
xml_ns0_filterContentDTO.description:
Represents a filter set content, stores filters conditions and columns configuration
Use this DTO to represent content of layouts type LayoutType.INCIDENT_QUERY_FILTER.

xml_ns0_dataTableCellDataDTO.title: dataTableCellDataDTO

id.description: The internal ID/name of the cell. This can be used to update a single cell value.

row_id.description: The internal ID of the row this cell is contained in

value.description: The value for the cell. The type of the value must match the column allowed value types.

xml_ns0_dataTableCellDataDTO.description: Contains the data of a specific cell in a data table row

xml_ns0_dataTableDataDTO.title: dataTableDataDTO

id.description: The internal id/name of the table data. This value is read-only except on create.

inc_id.description: The ID of the incident this table data refers to. This value is read-only.

rows.description: The data rows of the table

xml_ns0_dataTableDataDTO.description: Contains all of the data related to a user defined table on an incident

xml_ns0_dataTableRowDataDTO.title: dataTableRowDataDTO

actions.description: The list of actions available to the caller for execution.

cells.description: The mapping of column->cell data for the row. The mapping key can be specified using all names or all ids.

id.description: The internal ID of the row. This can be used to update a single row in a table. This value is read-only.

xml_ns0_dataTableRowDataDTO.description: Contains all of the data related to a table row on an incident

xml_ns0_geoUnassignedDTO.title: geoUnassignedDTO
xml_ns0_geoUnassignedDTO.description: Indicates an "unassigned" count for a particular geo. These unassigned counts would generally be for "country". For example, if you know that you lost 500 records for the United States but you didn't know what specific state the records were for, you'd put them in as unassigned for the United States geo (ID #1000): { "geo": 1000, "count": 500 }

xml_ns0_incidentCountsDTO.title: incidentCountsDTO

geo_counts.description: A map of the record counts for the different geographic regions involved with the incident. For example, the following indicates that 100 records were lost in California (ID #6) and 200 records were lost in Delaware (ID #9): { "6": 100, "9": 200 } The list of possible geos (with their IDs) is available in the constDTO (geos property).

total.description:
The total number of records that were lost.  This is calculated by the server and
is a read only property.

unassigneds.description: An list of objects that describes the "unassigned" records for the incident.

xml_ns0_incidentCountsDTO.description:
This type represents the counts of records that were lost as part of an
incident.

xml_ns0_incidentDataTypesDTO.title: incidentDataTypesDTO
xml_ns0_incidentDataTypesDTO.description: This is a dynamic map that indicates which data types (e.g. Credit card number, SSN or SIN, etc.) that were lost as part of the incident. The key portion of the map is the data type ID and the value portion is a true/false boolean indicating whether the data type was lost. For example, the following JSON object indicates that the first name (id #19) and last name (id #20) were lost: { "19": true, "20": true } The list of possible data types (with their ID values) is available in the constDTO (data_types property).

xml_ns0_partialIncidentDTO.title: partialIncidentDTO

create_date.description: The date the incident was created.

discovered_date.description:
The date the incident was discovered.  This is a required field and has significant
implications for privacy-related incidents.  Many of the tasks that get generated
will have their due dates set based on this date.

due_date.description: The earliest due date of any incident task.

id.description: The incident ID.

inc_training.description:
true if this is a training incident (aka simulation).  false indicates that it is
a normal incident.

name.description: The name of the incident.

owner_id.description:
The ID of the incident owner.

The list of all available users is in the fullOrgDTO (users property).

phase_id.description:
The ID of phase the incident is currently in (e.g. Engage, Detect/Analyze, Respond, Post-Incident).

The possible values are available in the fullOrgDTO (phases property).

plan_status.description:
The incident status.

The possible values with their names are available in constDTO (incident_statuses property).

xml_ns0_partialIncidentDTO.description: This object contains a minimal subset of the incident data.  It is useful for displaying in a list.

export_key.description: The key which uniquely identifies the object being imported

id.description: The phase ID.

name.description: The phase name.

order.description: This phases order number relative to the other phases. This field is read-only.

uuid.description: Unique identifier for the phase.

deleteable.description: Can the phase be deleted?  Certain phases cannot be deleted, such as the Initial and Complete phases.

reorderable.description: Can the phase be reorderd?  Certain phases cannot be reordered, such as the Initial and Complete phases.

content.description: The content for the layout.  The specific contents of the list depend on the type of the layout.

export_key.description: The key which uniquely identifies the object being imported

id.description: The ID of the layout.

name.description: The layout's name.

owner_id.description: The ID of the user that created the layout.  This is a read-only property.

perms.description: The permissions describing the actions the caller can perform on the layout.

type.description: The type of the layout.  The type dictates what content can be stored in the layout.

uuid.description: The system UUID of the object used as a backup to detect renames

xml_ns0_layoutPermsDTO.title: layoutPermsDTO

delete.description: Can the caller delete this layout?

edit.description: Can the caller edit this layout?

edit_permissions.description: Can the caller modify the permissions for this layout? Currently the available permissions are public or private.

xml_ns0_layoutPermsDTO.description: Represents the permissions on a layout.

condition.description: The condition "method". See the methodName enumeration for the list of possible values. Note that the methods that require a "previous" value are not supported in this context (e.g. "changed", "changed_to", "value_added").

field.description: The name of the field being compared.

value.description: The value being compared for the condition.

xml_ns0_layoutViewItemDTO.title: layoutViewItemDTO

content.description:
The content for the item.  The value here depends on the element property (see the list of
possible element property values).

element.description:
Gets the element. This can be one of:
  • field - the item is a field reference. The field name is stored in the content property.
  • html - the item is an HTML block. The HTML content is stored in the content property.
  • header - the item is a header. The header text is stored in the content property.
  • section - the item is a section. The content property is ignored. The list of sub-items is stored in the "fields" property.
  • tab - the item is a tab. The content property is ignored. The list of sub-items (sections, fields, etc.) is stored in the "fields" property.

field_type.description:
The type of object to which this view item applies. Currently, the following values are supported:
  • incident
  • actioninvocation

fields.description: The list of fields in the view.

predefined_uuid.description:
Some of the items are "predefined" by the server.  We give them a well-known UUID so users can
reset back to the known state.

show_if.description:
List of conditions that must be true in order to show the view (applicable only for items
with an "element" property value of "section").

show_link_header.description: Link header should be displayed or not. This property is for UI side use only

xml_ns0_layoutViewItemDTO.description: Represents an item inside a view.

xml_ns0_fieldDefDTO.title: fieldDefDTO

blank_option.description:
Should a blank option be selectable in the UI?  Enable this option if you'd like users to have the option of leaving
the field blank.

changeable.description:
Can the field values ever change?  For example, the incident create_date field cannot ever change
so changeable will be false for that field.

chosen.description:
Is the field a "chosen" field?  This appears in the Co3 UI as "Advanced UI".  It is valid only for select
and multiselect fields.  It's best to enable this option when there will be several values to choose from.
This option allows the user to search the list for a certain value, and is more visually appealing for longer
lists and multiselects."}

export_key.description: This value is used for export/import to uniquely represent this field

hide_notification.description:
The field should be hidden from the list of fields allowed in notification trigger conditions.  Generally
this should be false for custom fields.

input_type.description: The input type for this field (e.g. "select", "multiselect", "text", etc.). For a list of valid input types, see constDTO (input_types property).

internal.description: Is this field an internal Co3 field?  This value is read-only.

label_false.description: The label for a boolean false value. Default is "No" and is currently read-only.

label_null.description: The label for a boolean null value. Default is "Unknown" and is currently read-only.

label_true.description: The label for a boolean true value. Default is "Yes" and is currently read-only.

operation_perms.description: The "permissions" for the individual condition methods.

operations.description:
The set of valid condition operations for this field.  These are the conditions that can
appear in the notification or action triggers section.  This value is read-only.

order.description: The order of this column in the table (1 = leftmost)

perms.description: The permissions the caller has on this field. This value is read-only. This value is set based on the permissions of the caller. See FieldDefPermsDTO.

placeholder.description: The placeholder to display in the edit field (not applicable for all input types).

read_only.description: True if this is a read-only field, false otherwise.

required.description:
The required status of the field. Valid values:
  • "always" - a value is always required, even when initially creating the object.
  • "close" - a value is required before the object (incident) can be closed. The Co3 UI will prompt the user on close if a value is not available.
  • null - a value is optional

tooltip.description:
The tooltip to display next to the field (i.e. the popup text to display when the user
hovers over the "i" icon).

type_id.description: The internal ID of the type. This field is read-only.

uuid.description:
The UUID of this field.  This value is read-only.  The server sets this value when the field is
initially created.

values.description: The possible values for this field.  This is only applicable for select and multiselect fields.

xml_ns0_fieldDefDTO.description: Represents a field definition in the system.

xml_ns0_fieldDefPermsDTO.title: fieldDefPermsDTO

delete.description: True if this field can be deleted, false otherwise

modify_blank.description: True if the blank option of this field can be modified, false otherwise

modify_chosen.description: True if the chosen attribute of this field can be modified, false otherwise

modify_default.description: True if the default value of this field can be modified, false otherwise

modify_name.description: True if the name of this field can be modified, false otherwise

modify_operations.description: True if the operations of this field can be modified, false otherwise.

modify_required.description: True if the requiredness of this field can be modified, false otherwise

modify_type.description: The other types that this field can be changed to. e.g. select -> multiselect

modify_values.description: True if the values of this field can be modified, false otherwise

sort.description: True if this field can be sorted, false otherwise

xml_ns0_fieldDefPermsDTO.description: Defines the permissions available to the caller on a given field. This object is returned with each field object retrieved by the caller.

xml_ns0_fieldDefValueDTO.title: fieldDefValueDTO

default.description: Is this value the default?  Only one value in a set of values can be the default for the set.

hidden.description:
Is the value hidden? This is only used for a special case relating to IncidentType
values.  This is a readonly property.

uuid.description: Globally unique identifier for this value. This is a read-only field.

xml_ns0_fieldDefValueDTO.description: Represents a value in a select or multiselect field.

xml_ns0_fieldRequired.title: fieldRequired
xml_ns0_fieldRequired.description:
Indicates when (if ever) a field is required.  Use a value of null to indicate that a field
is strictly optional.

xml_ns0_fieldValModOperation.title: fieldValModOperation
xml_ns0_fieldValModOperation.description: The operation to perform on a field.

xml_ns0_inputType.title: inputType
xml_ns0_inputType.description: A type of input field in the system.

xml_ns0_methodNamePermsDTO.title: methodNamePermsDTO

show_in_auto_actions.description: Should this method appear in picklists for automatic actions?

show_in_manual_actions.description:
Should this method appear in picklists for manual actions?  For example,
methods that require "previous values" such as "changed_to" cannot be
used in manual actions because there is no concept of a previous value
when the list of visible manual actions are calculated.

show_in_notifications.description: Should this method appear in picklists for automatic notifications?

xml_ns0_methodNamePermsDTO.description:
Holds "permissions" applicable to a method name/operation, such as
whether it should appear in conditions for manual actions,
automatic actions and notifications.

xml_ns0_operationType.title: operationType
xml_ns0_operationType.description: Enumeration for operation types that can be applied to an object.

id.description: The internal ID of this field. This value is read-only. The server sets this value when the field is initially created.

name.description: The name of the field (e.g. 'name', 'incident_type_ids', etc.)

prefix.description:
The prefix to use when setting the field value in a DTO. For example, the prefix for the "data_source_ids" field is "pii". When setting the value in an incident, you must include "data_source_ids" in a sub-JSON object named "pii". For example: 
   {
     "id": 555,
     "name": "Test incident",
     ...
     "pii": {
       "data_source_ids": [1234, 1235],
       ...
     }
   }

text.description: The text displayed right next to the field (e.g. "Name", "Incident Type", etc.).

value.description:
The internal value of the field.  This is considered the "id" of the field and is
generated by the server when the field is created.

xml_ns0_typeDTO.title: typeDTO

actions.description: The list of actions defined for this type

display_name.description: The display name for the type.

export_key.description: This value is used for export/import to uniquely represent this type

fields.description: The fields supported for the type.

for_actions.description: True if an action can specify this type, false otherwise.

for_custom_fields.description: True if a custom field can be created for this type, false otherwise.

for_notifications.description: True if a notification can be created for this type, false otherwise.

id.description: The internal ID of the type.

parent_types.description:
The list of names of parent types. For example, the parent type of "artifact" would be "incident".
In the case of notes and attachments, the parent_types will contain both "task" and "incident".
The parent type of a Data Table is "incident".

This value is read-only except on create.

scripts.description: The list of scripts defined for this type

type_id.description:
The internal type id of the type. For built-in types, the type id maps to the same value as the internal ID. For custom types (Data Table), the type id is mapped one-to-many and have internal IDs >= 1000 
 0 = INCIDENT
 1 = TASK
 2 = NOTE
 3 = MILESTONE
 4 = ARTIFACT
 5 = ATTACHMENT
 6 = ACTIONINVOCATION
 7 = ORGANIZATION
 8 = DATATABLE

type_name.description: The name of the type.  For example, "incident" or "task".

uuid.description: The UUID for this type

xml_ns0_typeDTO.description:
Represents a type object in the system. This includes built-in types such as "incident" and "task",
as well as custom types (Data Table)

xml_ns0_typePropertiesDTO.title: typePropertiesDTO

can_create.description: True if a condition can be created for this type for when the object is created, false otherwise.

can_destroy.description: True if a condition can be created for this type for when the object is deleted, false otherwise.

for_who.description:
The list of potential recipients to which a notification is applicable to for this type.
e.g. for incident (added_members, owners, members) and for artifact (owners, members)

xml_ns0_typePropertiesDTO.description: Contains additional information about the type for conditions and notifications.

offset.description: The offset used to calculate the due date

timeframe_id.description: The internal ID of the timeframe

units.description: The units used to calculate the due date

xml_ns0_orgTimeframeDTO.description: Contains the information about the timeframe. Theses are used when calculating the due dates for built-in tasks.

xml_ns0_bucketBy.title: bucketBy
xml_ns0_bucketBy.description:
An enumeration of the possible buckets (groupings) for values when performing
pivots.

xml_ns0_bucketByDTO.title: bucketByDTO

bucket_values.description:
The list of possible values the BucketBy will be bucketed into. May be
empty, null, or not present if the values are not constant.

label.description: The display value for the BucketBy.

value.description: The value representing the BucketBy.

xml_ns0_bucketByDTO.description: Contains all of the information necessary to understand a BucketBy object.

xml_ns0_functionType.description: An enumeration representing the possible functions which may be applied to pivot cell contents to determine the cell value.

field_types.description: The list of PivotFieldTypes to which this function applies.

label.description: The display value for the FunctionType.

value.description: The value representing the FunctionType.

xml_ns0_functionTypeDTO.description: Contains all of the information necessary to understand a FunctionType object.

bucket_bys.description:
A list of possible bucketing types for pivoting services.

See BucketByDTO.
See BucketBy.

field_types.description:
A list of possible pivot field types for pivoting services.

See PivotFieldTypeDTO.
See PivotFieldType.

function_types.description:
A list of possible pivot function types for pivoting services.

See FunctionTypeDTO.
See FunctionType.

xml_ns0_pivotFieldType.description:
An enumeration representing the possible field types available for pivot
services.

bucket_bys.description: The list of buckets which apply to this PivotFieldType. May be empty, null, or not present if no buckets are applicable.

column_fields.description: The fields which will appear in the columns for the pivot table

filters.description:
The filters to apply to the query which will be performed to determine
the data set for the pivot.

function.description:
The function which will be applied to the cell contents of the pivot
table

offset.description:
The timezone offset in minutes which will be used to modify date values
to be in the appropriate timezone. A positive value for timezones before
UTC and a negative value for timezones after UTC

row_fields.description: The fields which will appear in the rows for the pivot table

xml_ns0_pivotQueryDTO.description: Contains all the necessary data to perform a pivot on an object type

attachments.description: All attachments which meet the query criteria.

max_results_exceeded.description: Indicates that results have been truncated because the number of matches exceeded the server maximum.

xml_ns0_attachmentResultsDTO.description: The results of a query on attachments.

incident_comment_match_ids.description: IDs of the incident comments which individually matched the query.

root_comments.description: All root comments which meet the query criteria or have children that do.

task_comment_match_ids.description: IDs of the task comments which individually matched the query.

xml_ns0_commentResultsDTO.description: The results of a query on comments.

data.description: Items returned in the current page.

recordsFiltered.description: Total records filtered for the current query.

recordsTotal.description: Total records found for the current query.

length.description: The maximum number of records to return in the response

recordsTotal.description: Total records for the current query.

fieldsToInclude.description: List of object handles for incident fields. See fieldDefDTO.

offset.description: Your timezone offset in minutes from the UTC. e.g. +240 for GMT-4 and -240 for GMT+4. See also JavaScript getTimezoneOffset() Method

xml_ns0_incidentSummaryDTO.description: Configuration options for exported incident data.

actions.description: The actions that reference this script.

id.description: The unique identifier for the script

language.description: The scripting language for this script.

name.description: The name for the script

object_type.description: The object type on which the script operates

xml_ns0_partialScriptDTO.description: Contains basic information about an invokable script.

creator_id.description: The creator of the script.  This is read-only value.

object_id.description: The internal id of the object to which this script applies to (e.g. incident, task, Data Table row, etc.)

object_parent_type_id.description: For Notes and Attachments objects, the object's parent type id: incident (0), or task (1)

object_type_id.description: The type id of the object's type

script_language.description: The script language (Currently there is only support for "python")

xml_ns0_scriptExecuteDTO.description:
Used for running scripts for debugging purposes.

keywords.description: The keywords available. At the top level e.g. incident/task, at the next level e.g. severity_code, plan_status

mappings.description:
The next level of mappings. The key is the keyword supporting additional mappings, and the value is the
metadata. e.g. incident -> { keywords -> [severity_code, plan_status, properties] }

snippets.description: The snippets available. Only available at the object level. e.g. addTask, addMilestone, etc

value.description: The code-completion value. This value is read-only.

score.description: Used for prioritization in the code-completion. Larger means higher priority. This value is read-only.

xml_ns0_scriptMetadataSuggestionDTO.description: Contains the base information necessary for suggestions for script code-completion

value.description: The value to set on the field

xml_ns0_scriptExecutionChangeDTO.description: Contains the information about a patch change to an object from the scripting service

task_notes_added.description: The notes to add to the task

tasks_added.description: The tasks to add to the incident

xml_ns0_categorySearchResultDTO.title: categorySearchResultDTO
xml_ns0_categorySearchResultDTO.description: This DTO class is deprecated in v28 and will be removed in v29. GET /rest/search and POST /rest/search are deprecated and being replaced by POST /rest/search_ex which uses a different DTO class to convey the results of the search.

xml_ns0_incidentArtifactResultDTO.title: incidentArtifactResultDTO
xml_ns0_incidentArtifactResultDTO.description: This DTO class is deprecated in v28 and will be removed in v29. GET /rest/search and POST /rest/search are deprecated and being replaced by POST /rest/search_ex which uses a different DTO class to convey the results of the search.

xml_ns0_incidentResultDTO.title: incidentResultDTO
xml_ns0_incidentResultDTO.description: This DTO class is deprecated in v28 and will be removed in v29. GET /rest/search and POST /rest/search are deprecated and being replaced by POST /rest/search_ex which uses a different DTO class to convey the results of the search.

filters.description: Filters for the query. The key is the TypeId ("incident", "task", ...), and, due to legacy reasons, the value is an array consisting of 1 QueryFilterDTO to store all the conditions on that TypeId

min_required_results.description:
The minimum number of results to retrieve for a given search.  If not specified, a server-specified limit
will be imposed

org_id.description: The org to restrict search to (or null for all orgs which the user is a member of)

types.description:
The types of object to restrict the search to. Can be null to request all types Types are the string form of the internal type id of the Resilient type. Composed of the following: 
 incident
 task
 note
 milestone
 artifact
 attachment
 datatable
For more information about type ids, refer to this

xml_ns0_searchExResultDTO.title: searchExResultDTO

inc_id.description:
The id of the incident to which the search result belongs.  If the search result is an incident, then inc_id
is identical to obj_id.

inc_name.description:
The name of the incident to which the search result belongs.  If the search result is an incident, then inc_name
is identical to obj_name.

inc_owner_id.description:
The name of the owner of the incident to which the search result belongs.  If the search result is an incident,
then inc_owner is identical to obj_owner.

match_field_name.description: The name of the search field where a match was found.

match_field_value.description:
The value of the search field where a match was found, including an indication of what term(s) matched the
full text search.

obj_create_date.description: The creation date of the search result.  This can be null for results which do not have a creation date stored.

obj_creator_id.description:
The name of the creator of the search result.  Datatables do not support a creator, so search results
of that type would be null.

obj_id.description: The unique identifier of the search result

obj_name.description:
The name of the search result object.  In the case of a data table row, this name represents the
programmatic name of the data table.

Can be null for objects with no names (e.g. notes)

obj_owner_id.description:
The name of the owner of the search result.  Search results of types milestone, artifact,
attachment and datatable do not support the notion of 'owner' so the value would be null.

In the case of a comment (type = note), obj_owner_id would represent a user who has subsequently
modified the comment.  If it hasn't been modified, this value would be null.

obj_state.description: The state of the search result.  This is only applicable for incidents and tasks.

org_id.description: The unique identifier of the Organization that this search result belongs to.

result.description: The actual object returned by the search

score.description: A score value for the search hit

task_id.description:
The id of the task to which the search result belongs.  This is only populated for task, task attachment,
and task notes.  In the case of task, task_id is identical to obj_id.
If the search result belongs to an incident only (i.e. incident, incident note, incident attachment, artifact
or datatable) then this result is null.

task_name.description:
The name of the task to which the search result belongs.  This is only populated for task, task attachment,
and task notes.  In the case of task, task_name is identical to obj_name.
If the search result belongs to an incident only (i.e. incident, incident note, incident attachment, artifact
or datatable) then this result is null.

type_id.description:
The type id of the result . Must be one of the following: 
 incident
 task
 note
 milestone
 artifact
 attachment
 datatable
For more information about type ids, refer to this

xml_ns0_searchExResultDTO.description: A single result from an elastic search

xml_ns0_searchExResultsDTO.description: A list of the results from an elastic search

xml_ns0_searchInputDTO.title: searchInputDTO

org_id.description: The org to restrict search to (null for all)

rpp.description: The maximum number of results to return (anything more than 25 will be set to 25).

types.description: The types of object to restrict the search to (Incident, Task, Comment)

user_id.description: The ID of the user to restrict results to

xml_ns0_searchInputDTO.description:
Holds the details of a search query. Used in the POST /rest/search endpoint.

This DTO class is deprecated in v28 and will be removed in v29. GET /rest/search and POST /rest/search are deprecated and being replaced by POST /rest/search_ex which uses a different DTO class to convey the inputs to a search.

objects.description:
The minimal representation of the objects which were used to determine
the value for this cell.

value.description:
The value for this cell. It could be a count, average, etc. Most likely
it is a number of some kind.

xml_ns0_pivotCellDTO.description: Contains the information about a cell in a pivot table.

column_headers.description: The column field headers for the pivot data

column_values.description: The column field values hierarchy for the pivot data

column values. Each cell includes the minimalistic representation of the
data which makes up the cell value.

row_headers.description: The row field headers for the pivot data

row_values.description: The row field values hierarchy for the pivot data

xml_ns0_pivotDTO.description: The result of performing a pivot on object data.

xml_ns0_pivotHeaderDTO.description:

Type

children.description: The children values for this value

xml_ns0_statisticsIncidentDTO.title: statisticsIncidentDTO
xml_ns0_statisticsIncidentDTO.description:
This is the DTO used to represent an incident for statistical purposes. It is
a minimalistic representation

actions.description: The list of actions available to the caller for execution.

active.description:
Is the task currently active?  A task can become inactive when incident information
changes to make the task no longer applicable.  We do not delete the task in this case
because work could have been done on the task.

at_id.description: The automatic task ID (for tasks created based on an "automatic task"). See the AutomaticTaskREST resource for more information.

attachments_count.description: Number of attachments on this task

auto_task_id.description: The automatic task ID (for tasks created based on an "automatic task"). See the AutomaticTaskREST resource for more information. This value is being deprecated in v27 and will be removed in v28. Applications using this property should switch to using the at_id property instead.

cat_name.description:
The name of the rollup (category) to which this task was assigned.
This is a readonly property.

category_id.description:
The category to which this task belongs.

The FullOrgDTO (task_categories property) contains the possible category values.

closed_date.description: Get the date the task was closed. This field is read only.

creator.description: Gets a user object that describes the task creator.

custom.description:
true for custom tasks; false for built-in tasks.  Custom tasks are those
which are manually created on an incident.

due_date.description: The task due date.  null indicates that the task has no assigned due date.

frozen.description:
true if the incident to which this task belongs is "frozen" because of a
legal hold.  This is a readonly property.

id.description: The task's ID.  This is a readonly property.

inc_id.description: The ID of the incident to which this task belongs.  This is a readonly property.

inc_name.description: The name of the incident to which this task belongs.

inc_owner_id.description: The owner of the incident to which this task belongs.  This is a readonly property.

inc_training.description:
true if the incident to which this task belongs is a training incident (simulation).
This is a readonly property.

init_date.description:
The date this task was activated.  As an incident changes, it is possible for a task
to become "inactive".  For example, if you originally say that 100 records were lost
in Massachusetts then latter revised that number to 0, the Massachusetts notification
tasks would be deactivated.  You could later reactivate the task by entering numbers
in for Massachusetts.  They are not deleted because work may have been done on
them.  So the init_date (activation date) would be either the date the task was originally
created, or the date it was most recently activated.  This is a readonly property.

instr_text.description: The textual instructions for the task. Note that this field only applies when instructions are added by the user. This will override the default instructions for the task. In order to get the default task instructions, you use the TaskREST endpoint.

members.description:
The list of task members.  If this value is null then the task is accessible by all
incident members.

name.description: The name of the task.

notes_count.description: Number of notes on this task

owner_fname.description: The task owner's first name.  This is a readonly property.

owner_id.description: The owner of the task.  null if the task has no owner.

owner_lname.description: The task owner's last name.  This is a readonly property.

perms.description:
Indicates that the current user's permissions are to various elements of the
incident.  For example, is the current user allowed to change the membership
of the incident (stored in the change_members property of the returned object).

phase_id.description:
The phase to which this task belongs.

The FullOrgDTO (phases property) contains the possible phase values.

regs.description: Information about the regulators that triggered this task.

required.description: true if this task is required; false if it is optional.  This is a readonly property.

status.description: The task's status. The possible task status values are available in the constDTO (task_statuses property).

xml_ns0_evaluatableConditionsDTO.description: DTO used to deserialize and store all the fields necessary to evaluate a set of conditions

workflow_id.description: The workflow this content is for

xml.description: The source XML of the workflow (e.g. BPMN XML)

content.description: The content from within the Workflow Engine (only used for export)

creator_id.description: The user that created the workflow

description.description: The textual description of the workflow

export_key.description: This field is used to identify the object during import

last_modified_by.description: The user the workflow was last modified by

last_modified_time.description: The date the workflow was last modified

name.description: The display name of the workflow

object_type.description: The object type of the workflow. e.g. Incident, Task, etc.

programmatic_name.description: The programmatic name of the workflow.

uuid.description: This field is used to identify the object during import

workflow_id.description: The internal ID of the workflow

xml_ns0_workflowDTO.description: Contains the information about a workflow

column_number.description:
The column number in the xml where the error was generated.
Generally, the BPMN parser will return either a list of nodes or a line number and column number,
so this element will frequently be 0.

error.description: The error message generated by the BPMN parser.

line_number.description:
The line number in the xml where the error was generated.
Generally, the BPMN parser will return either a list of nodes or a line number and column number,
so this element will frequently be 0.

node_hints.description:
The node(s) which caused the error.
Generally, the BPMN parser will return either a list of nodes or a line number and column number,
so this list will frequently be empty.
Items other than nodes can appear in this list.

xml_ns0_workflowStatusDTO.title: workflowStatusDTO

problems.description: The list of problems that caused an error.

workflow.description: The workflow generated by a successful result.

xml_ns0_workflowStatusDTO.description: Indicates the status of a workflow deployment.

xml_ns0_textContentDTO.title: textContentDTO

content.description:
The actual text content.  This can be either HTML or plain text depending on the
value of the format property.

format.description: The format of the text content.

xml_ns0_textContentDTO.description:
Represents text content (e.g. incident description, incident resolution summary, artifact description, etc.). The Resilient server will accept either a JSON string or an object of the form: 
   {
     "format": "html|text",
     "content": "content text or HTML (depending on format)"
   }

If you send a string, you must be aware of the "rich_text" setting on the field you're sending. If sending an object, you can supply content in either "text" or "html" format. The server will make a best effort to convert the content into the format needed to display the field in the UI.

On output (e.g. the return from a GET, PUT or POST), the textContentDTO is written as a JSON string by default. The content of the string object will depend on the "rich_text" property of the field. So if "rich_text" is true, then the content will be HTML. If "rich_text" is false, then the content will be in plain text. Note that it is technically possible for the content to be stored on the server in plain text for fields that are marked as rich text (or vice-versa). When the server is in the default mode, it will convert the data to the format specified in the field definition and write it out as a JSON string. For example, if the content on the server is plain text but the field definition is "rich text", then the server will perform a plain text to HTML conversion. The reverse can occur too, for example if an API program sends HTML but the field definition is not rich text then the server will perform a best effort at an HTML to plain text conversion.

An API client can request that data be sent in whatever format it is in on the server by specifying the "text_content_output_format=objects_no_convert" query string or HTTP header. In this case, the server will send the full object.

An API client can also request that data be sent as an object, but have conversion applied by specifying the "text_content_output_format=objects_convert" query string or HTTP header. In this case, the server will send the full object and convert to the format specified in the field definition (if "rich_text" is true then the format will always be returned as "html" and if it's false then it'll always be returned as "text").

An API client can also ask for data in either HTML or text format specifically (regardless of the field definition and the format in which the data is stored) by using either the text_content_output_format=objects_html or text_content_output_format=objects_text request query string or HTTP header.

xml_ns0_textFormat.title: textFormat
xml_ns0_textFormat.description: Represents the format in which the content in a textContentDTO object is stored.

xml_ns0_objectHandle.title: objectHandle

id.description:
Gets the ID referred to by this object (generally an integer value).  This can be null in cases
where you know the name, but not the ID.

name.description:
Gets the name referred to by this object.  This can be null in cases where you know
the ID but not the name.

xml_ns0_objectHandle.description:
A handle to an object in the REST API. The handle can be an object ID (integer) or an object name (string). The server will recognize the type and lookup the object.

For example, the incidentDTO's resolution_id field can be specified as the name of the resolution selection (e.g. "Duplicate") or with it's ID value (which you have to lookup separately).

Note that data is returned from the server with the ID values by default. If you wish to receive name values back for objectHandle fields from the server instead, you can set handle_format=names either in a query string (e.g. https://resilient.mycompany.com/rest/orgs/:orgId/incidents?handle_format=names) or in an HTTP header. For a description of the possible values of the handle_format query string parameter/HTTP header, see objectHandleFormat.

When setting ObjectHandle values the server will work with either format. You only need to indicate what type of output you want. Versions of the Resilient Systems server prior to v23 only accepted ID values and would convert string values ("55") to integers where possible. As of v23, the server will not automatically convert strings to their number equivalent. So if your API program used to send "55" assuming that the server would convert it to 55, you will either have to change your program to send the integer or you can work around the problem by setting handle_format=ids, which will again allow the conversion to happen.

xml_ns0_objectHandleList.title: objectHandleList
xml_ns0_objectHandleList.description:
Represents a list of ObjectHandle objects.  Each item in the list can be either
a name (string) or ID (integer).

email.description: The email address (user name) to authenticate as.

interactive.description:
true to indicate that the session is an interactive one.  You can only have one interactive session at a time,
so if there is another interactive session it will be invalidated.  The default is false, which means that multiple
simultaneous sessions are allowed.  interactive sessions will not invalidate other non-interactive sessions.  The
default value is false.

password.description: The password to use to authenticate.

by whitespace for artifact types that support multiple values (the constDTO.artifact_types will
return a list of artifact types and each object has an is_multi_aware that indicates whether
multiple values are supported).  This capability is useful if you want to include a list of,
say, IP addresses that are to be added to the incident.

Deletes an incident comment.  Note that deleting a comment that is a parent of another
comment will cause it to get marked as deleted and it's text will get blanked out,
but the object will still exist to maintain the comment hierarchy.  If you want to
completely delete a parent comment, you must delete all it's children first.

patch.description:
Patches multiple incidents.

Note that if a patch to an incident fails because of a conflicting edit made by another user, that entire incident (all patches for that incident) will fail. Other incidents may succeed.

For other types of failures (like if you reference an object that doesn't exist), the entire operation will fail. Also, business rule validation failures (such as "require on close" failures) will cause the entire operation to fail (for all incidents listed in the patch).

get.description:
Gets the timeframe to units/offset mapping for the organization.  Many regulators are
vague about how much time between when an incident is discovered and when various
tasks are due.  For example, the regulation may say that a task must be performed
"Without unreasonable delay".  Co3 has given that a day value of 45 days, however
you can customize that by doing a PUT to the OrgREST timeframes endpoint.
